title: Implement 'Continue Story' Feature
description:
Implement context-aware story suggestions ('What happens next?') at the end of a generation. 

Architecture:
1. Backend: After story finishes, ask Gemini to generate 3 short plot options based on the story text.
2. Protocol: Send '{ type: "suggestions", content: ["Option A", "Option B"] }'.
3. Frontend: Display these chips at the bottom of the story scroll view.
4. Interaction: Clicking an option sends it as a new prompt. Ideally, we append to the current story rather than clearing it, creating a multi-chapter experience.

title: Backend: Generate Plot Suggestions
description: Implement 'GenerateSuggestions(storyText)' using Gemini Flash. Call this at the end of the story stream and send the list via WebSocket.

title: Frontend: Display Plot Options
description: Handle 'suggestions' message type. Render chips at the bottom of the book. Update 'sendMessage' to support appending/continuing story mode.

title: Backend: Implement Story Summarizer
description: Create  function using . Compress story history into a concise summary context to send to the client.

description: Update  to accept  from the client. Inject this context into the generation prompt ('Previous Story Context: ...'). Update  struct.

title: Refactor UI for Linear Story Flow
description:
Refactor the frontend to support a continuous, linear story format (Chapter 1 -> Chapter 2 -> ...). 

Requirements:
1. State: Replace separate title/image/transcript variables with a  structure.
2. UI: Render the story as a list of Chapters, each containing .
3. Suggestions: Move the plot suggestions *inside* the scrollable view, immediately following the last paragraph, to visually connect them to the story context.

title: Visual Scenes with Gemini 3 Pro Image
description: Implement a pipeline to analyze the story, create image prompts, and use gemini-3-pro-image-preview to generate scene illustrations. Display these alongside the text. Integrate with the 'Continue Story' feature.

title: Animate Visual Scene Introduction
description:
Implement a polished, 'magical' entrance animation for the generated story images. 

Requirements:
1. Avoid harsh layout jumps; use 'AnimatedSize' or similar to expand the space smoothly.
2. The image itself should fade/scale in (e.g., 'FadeInImage' with a custom curve, or a 'ScaleTransition').
3. Consider a 'shimmer' or 'pulse' placeholder while the image is loading if the URL is known before the bytes arrive.
4. The animation should feel cohesive with the 'Storybook' aesthetic (e.g., an ink-reveal effect or soft dissolve).

title: Dynamic Scene Detection for Visuals
description: Enhance Visual Scenes (Option B) by analyzing the story stream for scene changes or key emotional moments. When a scene change is detected, generate and push a new image to the client.

title: Layout: Fixed Visuals Panel
description:
Refactor Desktop layout to a Split Screen: 
1. Left Pane: Scrollable Text History (The Book).
2. Right Pane: Fixed, non-scrolling container displaying the *latest* generated image.
3. Mobile: Retain the inline [Text + Image] layout for vertical scrolling.
4. Note: On Desktop, previous images are not shown in the scroll history (focus is on current scene).

title: Frontend Maintenance & Cleanup
description: Address static analysis issues and fix broken tests.

title: Fix Frontend Lints & Deprecations
description: Replace deprecated 'withOpacity' with 'withValues', remove unused imports, and ensure 'package:web' is properly declared.

title: Fix Widget Tests
description: Update widget_test.dart to use 'EchoApp' instead of the non-existent 'MyApp'.

title: Refine Story Prompt for Better Narrative
description: Update the system prompt to generate stories with a reasonable narrative arc and at least 3 paragraphs, removing the 100-word limit. Aim for a richer storytelling experience.

title: Support Model Selection
description: Frontend should allow selecting the Gemini TTS model (Flash Lite, Flash, Pro) in addition to the voice. Backend needs to accept and use this model parameter.

title: Refine Input Area UI
description: Move the Voice and Model selection DropdownButtons to the right of the TextField. Update the TextField label to 'Enter your story topic...'. Ensure the layout handles the width constraints gracefully.

title: Layout: Side-by-Side Chapter View
description:
Refactor Chapter layout to side-by-side [Text | Image] on wider screens. 

1. Responsive Layout: Use Row on Desktop/Tablet (> 600px), Column on Mobile.
2. Animation: When image arrives, animate its entry into the Row (Text width adjusts).
3. Interaction: Tap image to expand into an 80% screen dialog (Lightbox).
4. Structure: Title remains centered above the content.

title: Generate and Display Story Title
description: Ask the model to generate a title for the story and display it prominently above the teleprompter area in the UI.

title: UI: End Story Action
description:
Add an 'End Story' chip to the Plot Suggestions list. Clicking it should: 
1. Clear  (hiding the suggestion row).
2. Clear  (resetting the story memory).
3. Keep the current  visible (so the user can read the finished story).
4. Allow the user to type a new topic in the Input Area to start fresh.

title: Refine Active Text Highlighting
description: Currently, the highlighting logic is simple: the last received sentence is 'active' (black), and everything else is dimmed. This is inaccurate because text arrives faster than audio. We need to sync the visual highlighting with the audio playback progress, potentially using the  or a similar mechanism to highlight the sentence *actually* being spoken.

title: Improve Sentence Splitting Logic
description: The current sentence splitter splits on '.?!' or length > 100. This can break abbreviations (e.g., 'Mr.') or long sentences unnaturally. We need a smarter heuristic or regex.

title: Fix Docker Build Failure
description: The 'COPY frontend/build/web' step is failing. The artifacts are likely excluded by .gcloudignore or .dockerignore.

title: Implement Voice Selection
description: Frontend should allow selecting from the Chirp voice list. Backend should parse JSON payload and use selected voice.

title: Configurable Model Versions
description: Refactor backend to load Gemini model names from environment variables (GEMINI_MODEL_STORY, GEMINI_MODEL_SUMMARY, GEMINI_MODEL_IMAGE) with sensible defaults.

title: Animated Ambient Background
description: Implement a subtle, animated background for 'The Book' container. Requirements: 1. Use a custom ShaderMask or AnimatedContainer with a gradient that slowly shifts colors (e.g., deep purple to midnight blue) or opacity. 2. Alternatively, use a Perlin noise shader (if performant on Web) to create a 'fog' or 'magical dust' effect. 3. The background should be visible even when the story is empty (fresh state), providing visual interest. 4. Ensure text contrast remains high (use semi-transparent overlay if needed).

title: Expand Quick Start Suggestions
description: Implement AI-Powered Prompt Refresh. Backend: Add GeneratePrompts (Gemini Flash) to create 4 creative story starters. Frontend: Add a Refresh icon button next to the Quick Start chips. When clicked, show a spinner, send { type: get_prompts } to backend. Replace chips with new prompts upon receipt.

title: UI: Sync Visual Panel with Scroll Position
description: Enhance the Split Screen layout by syncing the Right Panel image with the currently visible Chapter text in the Left Panel. 1. Implementation: Use ScrollController offsets or a visibility detection package to determine the 'active' chapter. 2. Logic: When the active chapter changes, update the Right Panel to display that chapter's image. 3. Outcome: Allows users to 're-live' previous scenes visually when scrolling back through the story history.

title: Fix Deployment Failure (Beads Socket)
description: Deployment failed because .beads/bd.sock was uploaded. Add .beads/ to .gcloudignore.
